--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-04 ---

Follow-up visit #1 for patient SA-P002.

Vitals: BP 117/71 mmHg, HR 84 bpm, Weight 94.7 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 6.52 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 16.13 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 35.48 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.5 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 9.06 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.59 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 2 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-06-25 ---

Patient SA-P002 presents for scheduled cycle 2 visit.

VS: 133/70 | HR 83 | Wt 78.0 kg. Patient mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

Neuropathic symptoms noted: severe (Grade 3). Patient describes onset around day 31. Resolved by day 36. No dose modification required.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 6.31 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 13.9 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 36.75 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 15.38 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 9.09 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.61 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

Restaging CT shows stable disease. Target lesions within +/-15% of prior measurements. No new lesions. RECIST: SD.

PSA level is 8.18 ng/mL (decrease 1.2% from baseline).

Plan: Continue therapy per protocol with supportive medications. Return for cycle 3 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-07-16 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 3. Attempted phone contact — voicemail left.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-06 ---

Visit 4 clinical encounter for SA-P002.

VS: 150/69 | HR 73 | Wt 81.9 kg. Patient mildly fatigued but alert and oriented.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 4.38 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 15.87 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 37.37 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.58 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 8.5 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.61 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

Imaging assessment: Target lesion decreased from baseline — measured reduction of approximately 23.6%. Partial response per RECIST 1.1 criteria.

Serum PSA: 6.33 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 23.6% compared to baseline.

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-08-27 ---

Routine protocol visit 5. Patient ID: SA-P002.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 136/81, heart rate 70, weight 78.4 kg.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 4.61 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 14.84 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 37.31 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.61 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 8.43 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.62 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 6 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-09-17 ---

Follow-up visit #6 for patient SA-P002.

On exam, BP is 131/77, pulse 62, wt 80.3 kg. Patient appears well-nourished and in no acute distress.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 3.01 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 20.71 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 38.87 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 14.36 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.97 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.63 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

Restaging CT demonstrates complete disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. RECIST assessment: Complete Response (CR).

PSA level is 0.74 ng/mL (decrease 91.1% from baseline).

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-08 ---

SA-P002 — Cycle 7, Day 1 visit.

VS: 141/74 | HR 77 | Wt 92.5 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 3.87 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 21.16 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 39.62 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.63 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.86 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.75 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 8 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-10-29 ---

Follow-up visit #8 for patient SA-P002.

Vitals: BP 134/90 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, Weight 77.5 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 3.73 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0]
  - ALT: 19.49 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 38.37 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 13.8 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.27 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.66 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3] (LOW)

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (43.4% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

PSA now 4.69 ng/mL — decrease 43.4% from initial value.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 9 scheduled in 3 weeks.
